text: Eliphaz’s Third Speech
Then\f + \fr 22:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
“Can a man be of use to God?
Yes, can \add the\add* wise be of use to him?
\add Is\add* it a pleasure to Shaddai if you are righteous,
or\f + \fr 22:3 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* a gain if you make your ways blameless?
Does he reprove you because of your reverence
\add or\add* enter into judgment with you?
\add Is\add* not your wickedness great,
and there is no end to your iniquities?
“Indeed, you have required a pledge from your family for nothing,
and you have stripped off \add the\add* clothes of \add the\add* naked.
You have given no water \add for the\add* weary to drink,
and you withheld food from \add the\add* hungry.
And the land ⸤belongs to the man of power⸥,\f + \fr 22:8 \ft Literally “man of power for him” \f*
and ⸤the favored⸥\f + \fr 22:8 \ft Literally “lifted up of face” \f* lives in it.
You have sent widows away empty-handed,
and \add the\add* arms of orphans were crushed.
Therefore trapping nets \add are\add* all around you,
and panic suddenly terrifies you,
or \add it is so\add* dark you cannot see,
and a flood of water covers you.
“\add Is\add* not God \add in the\add* height of \add the\add* heavens?
But\f + \fr 22:12 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* see how lofty are ⸤the highest stars⸥.\f + \fr 22:12 \ft Literally “top of stars,” or “head of stars” \f*
And you ask, ‘What does God know?
Can he judge through deep gloom?
Thick clouds \add are\add* a covering for him, so that he does not see;
and he walks about on \add the\add* dome of heaven.’
Will you keep \add to the\add* way of old
that \add the\add* people of mischief have trod,
who were snatched away ⸤before their time⸥,\f + \fr 22:16 \ft Literally “and not time” \f*
whose foundation was washed away \add by\add* a current?
\add Those\add* who said to God, ‘Turn away from us,’
and ‘What can Shaddai do to us?’
Yet\f + \fr 22:18 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* he himself\f + \fr 22:18 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* filled up their houses \add with\add* good \add things\add*,
but\f + \fr 22:18 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* \add the\add* schemes of \add the\add* wicked are repugnant to me.
\add The\add* righteous see, and they rejoice,
but\f + \fr 22:19 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* \add the\add* innocent \add one\add* mocks at them.
⸤Surely⸥\f + \fr 22:20 \ft Literally “If not” \f* our foe perishes,
and fire has consumed their remainder.\f + \fr 22:20 \ft Or “their wealth” \f*
“Please reconcile yourself with him,
and be at peace; ⸤in this way⸥,\f + \fr 22:21 \ft Literally “by them” \f* good will come to you.
Please receive instruction from his mouth,
and place his words in your heart.
If you return to Shaddai, you will be restored;
\add if\add* you remove wickedness from your tent,
and \add if you\add* put gold ore in \add the\add* dust,
and \add the\add* gold of Ophir in \add the\add* rock of wadis,
then\f + \fr 22:25 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Shaddai will be your gold ore
and ⸤your precious silver⸥.\f + \fr 22:25 \ft Literally “silver of the best for you,” or “silver of the best belonging to you” \f*
Indeed, then you will delight yourself in Shaddai,
and ⸤you will expect that God will be good to you⸥.\f + \fr 22:26 \ft Literally “you will lift up to God your face” \f*
You will pray to him, and he will hear you,
and you will pay your vows.
And you will decide on a matter, and it will be established for you,
and light will shine on your ways.
When they are humiliated, ⸤you say⸥,\f + \fr 22:29 \ft Literally “and you say,” or “then you say” \f* ‘\add It is\add* pride,’
for\f + \fr 22:29 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he saves ⸤the humble⸥.\f + \fr 22:29 \ft Literally “downward of eyes” \f*
He will deliver the guilty,
and he will escape because of the cleanness of your hands.”
